document.masterDocTitle: The true female of Alloclubionoides kimi (Araneae: Amaurobiidae) from Korea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The true female of Alloclubionoides kimi (Araneae: Amaurobiidae) from Korea

subSubSection.paragraph:
Coelotes kimi
Paik, 1974
, p. 169 , figs 1–4 (description of ɗ)

Ambanus kimi : Ovtchinnikov, 1999
, p. 64 (transferred male from
Coelotes
):
Namkung, 2001
, p. 395 , fig 28.9 a-c (ɗ, misidentified Ψ).

Material examined : One ɗ and one Ψ ( NIBR ), two ɗ and two Ψ ( LBHU ), by trap (
28 August 2007
–
17 January 2008
), Mt. Jirisan (GPS:
35 ° 15 ’N
,
127 ° 38 ’E
), Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do, leg. B.W. Kim. All specimens were collected on the ground among stones and leaf litter by pitfall trap.

Dimensions (mm) . Female: total length 9.9 ; cheliceral length 2.3 , width 1.2 , cheliceral fang length 1.1 ; clypeal height 0.3 ; dorsal shield of prosoma length 4.6 , width 3.0, height 1.7 ; gnathocoxae length 1.4 , width 0.8 ; labium length 0.8 , width 0.7 ; sternum length 2.3 , width 1.8 ; AER 0.95 , PER 1.23 , AME 0.14 , ALE 0.21 , PME 0.21 , PLE 0.21 . Eye formula ALE=PME= PLE>AME. Palp 4.4 (femur 1.5 , patella 0.6 , tibia 0.9 , cymbium 1.4 ). First leg 10.3 (femur 3.0, patella 1.4 , tibia 2.3 , metatarsus 2.3 , tarsus 1.3 ), second leg 9.1 ( 2.7 , 1.3 , 1.8 , 2.1 , 1.2 ), third leg 8.9 ( 2.5 , 1.3 , 1.6 , 2.3 , 1.2 ), fourth leg 12.4 ( 3.3 , 1.5 , 2.6 , 3.5 , 1.5 ). Leg formula IV>I>II>III. Opisthosoma length 4.8 , width 3.0, height 2.7 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–9.
Alloclubionoides kimi (Paik, 1974)
from Korea, female. 1 Habitus, dorsal view. 2 Eye area and clypeus, front view. 3 Chelicerae, posterior view. 4 Gnathocoxa and labium, ventral view. 5 Sternum, ventral view. 6 Forth leg, left part, prolateral view. 7–8 Epigynum, ventral view (7 uncleared, 8 cleared). 9 Vulva, dorsal view. Abbreviations: AT, atrium; CD, copulatory duct; CH, chilum; EF, epigynal furrow; FD, fertilization duct; GO, genital opening; SH, spermathecal head; SP, spermatheca.

subSubSection.paragraph: I wish to express my sincere thanks to Mr. J. Namkung the Korean Institute of Biospeleology, Dr X. Xu of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, Dr X.P. Wang of the University of Florida for many valuable comments and providing several important papers. This research was supported financially by the Korea Research Foundation Grant (KRF- 2006 - 005- J01901 ).
